content.description: Start the same as for Tilt-A-Whirl, but go up, and break left using slopey crimp rail and small crimps out left. Proceed up to a sloper knob, and go to the lip.
content.location: It is on the right side of the main Tombstone Wall.

content.description: This is located 5 feet left of Guillotine and just up the hill. Stand/squat start on the right hand side of the main Tombstone Wall. Move up to a big incut sidepull, and climb straight up. Top out on the juggy lip just right of the small boulder.
content.location: It is located 5 feet left of Guillotine on the right side of the main Tombstone Wall.

content.description: Start standing on the pedestal in the corner left of the orange arête. Follow the thin seam stemming to a solid topout.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter in case you land on the pedestal at the start.
content.location: This is about 20 feet up the hill from Guillotine. Follow the cliff left into a corner.

content.description: Stand start, and climb the obvious finger crack. A TR can be set up from a large tree. A fall from the crux would be terrible. This has good movement and jams. It was likely done by Rich Baker's crew back in early naughts.
content.location: Facing Guillotine, it’s at 5 o’clock about 30 feet away.

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand sidepull and a right hand on a downward slope. Throw a right heel, and perform a levitation act to get to the lip.
content.location: It is down the hill from the Tombstone Wall/Guillotine Boulders and to the right of the W34 Boulder, as you walk down the hill. The boulder is on the left of W34, if looking up the hill from the bottom.

content.description: This is a nice, little, slab warm-up. Start with your left hand on a small crimp at chest height and your right hand on a good edge down and right. Rock up onto the slab, and top out.
content.location: It is left of Forest Gump and Box of Chocolates on the slab side. The boulder is located above the Tombstone Crag.

content.description: Sit start the arete about 30 feet down and left of the problem Guillotine. Thin.
Do the same start as Cinderella Ate My Daughter, but once up on the are arete, reach right for a crimp seam. Top out straight up. This is essentially a direct finish to Cinderella.
Stand start on the face about 75 feet in front of the problem Guillotine, and climb straight up the clean, granite face. The sit start is a project.
Sit start the left arete, and work your way up using compression. Mantel the topout. This is sharp!
Stand start on the left arete of the dead obvious, striking, sharp-edged arete. Climb up the terrifying arete.
Sit start on the far left end of the boulder, and climb pretty much straight up and top out..
content.location: Just before you drop down to the main cluster of boulders in the valley, this boulder sits in an opening.

content.description: Sit start in the center of the W34 Boulder on jugs. Pull up to a good crimp, and work your way up to a mantel topout.
content.location: It is on W34 just down the hill from Guillotine.

content.description: Sit start squeezing wide aretes and awkward feet. Pull on, bump left hand up, and figure out how to use the left arete to get to the top.
content.location: It is down the hill from the Tombstone Wall/Guillotine Boulders and to the right of the W34 Boulder, as you walk down the hill. The boulder is on the left of W34, if looking up the hill from the bottom.

content.description: Stand start under the lip in the kinda crumbly pockets, and send the crack. The wall to the left is off.
content.location: Climb the next crack to the left of Quagmire.

content.description: Sit start the far right side of the W34 Boulder. Your left hand is on a juggy rail while your right is on a crimp knob on the arete. Pull on using the hidden foot in the right crevice, and slap up the arete. Body tension and crimps out left will lead you to a mantel topout.
content.location: It is on the W34 Boulder, just down the hill from Guillotine.

content.description: Stand start just around the corner from Forest Gump with your left hand on a small sidepull and your right hand on the large, ear-shaped edge. The jiggy feet for Forest Gump are off. Climb straight up.
content.location: It is just left of Forest Gump on top of the Tombstone Crag.

content.description: Sit start the blunt, orange arete about 20 feet in front of the problem Guillotine.
Traverse starting on ledges on the right side of the boulder.
content.location: It is on the hill above the Tombstone Boulders. The climbable face is opposite the trail, so you have to walk around the boulder to see it.

content.description: Sit start on the lower portion of the arete with your hands on large sidepull. A big move out left to jugs leads to slapping sloper up right. Squeeze your way to the top.
content.location: It is on the far left side of Tombstone Wall.

content.description: This area has about 6-8 boulder problems with capacity for more and is quite secluded. Discovered by Bob Parrott, these problems fly under the radar.
